answers.feedback_html: Group 1 and group 17 would form strong ionic bonds. Group 1 will give an electron easily and group 17 will accept an electron to attain a more stable configuration. Therefore, compounds like NaCl and LiF will be formed.

Group 1 elements are likely to form ionic bonds by giving up the one electron in its valence shell. However, group 14 elements are missing 4 electrons, and are more likely to share electrons with other elements through covalent bonds.
Group 18 elements have a filled valence shell and will not likely form any bonds.
Group18 elements have a filled valence shell and will not likely form any bonds.

stem_html: Looking at the above figure, can you infer which two groups together will form a strong ionic bond?

answers.content_html: hemoglobin, red blood cells, blood, blood vessels, cardiovascular system
answers.feedback_html: The correct ranking with respect to increasing complexity is hemoglobin, red blood cells, blood, blood vessels, cardiovascular system.

answers.content_html: hemoglobin, red blood cells, blood, artery, cardiovascular system
answers.feedback_html: Veins are a part of the cardiovascular system. Veins and arteries are both types of blood vessels.

answers.content_html: red blood cells, hemoglobin, blood, blood vessels, cardiovascular system
answers.feedback_html: Red blood cells have higher complexity than hemoglobin.

answers.content_html: oxygen, carbon dioxide, red blood cells, hemoglobin, blood, artery, cardiovascular system
answers.feedback_html: Oxygen and carbon dioxide are not part of the cardiovascular system.

stem_html: Consider the cardiovascular system. Rank in order of increasing complexity all its levels of organization starting with the hemoglobin.
